struct  MCRec

Detailed Description

The SkCanvas class holds the "draw" calls. To draw something, you need 4 basic components: A SkBitmap to hold the pixels, a SkCanvas to host the draw calls (writing into the bitmap), a drawing primitive (e.g. SkRect, SkPath, text, SkBitmap), and a SkPaint (to describe the colors and styles for the drawing).

Member Function Documentation

void SkCanvas::clipDeviceRgn (  const SkRegion &  deviceRgn  ) 
 

Similar to clipRect() and clipPath(), this call restricts subsequent drawing to the intersection of the current clip and the specified region. NOTE: this region is specified in device coordinates, not local coordinates, and so unlike the parameters in clipRect() and clipPath(), this is NOT transformed by the CTM, but it is "removed" when restore() is called.

void SkCanvas::clipPath (  const SkPath &   ) 
 

Intersect the current clip with the specified path. The path is first transformed by the current matrix.

SkScalar  top,
SkScalar  right,
SkScalar  bottom

Intersect the current clip with the specified rectangle. The rectangle is first transformed by the current matrix.

void SkCanvas::clipRect (  const SkRect &   ) 
 

Intersect the current clip with the specified rectangle. The rectangle is first transformed by the current matrix.

bool SkCanvas::concat (  const SkMatrix &   ) 
 

Preconcat the current matrix with the specified matrix. returns true if the operation succeeded (e.g. didn't overflow)

U8CPU  g,

void SkCanvas::drawCircle (  SkScalar  cx,
SkScalar  cy,
SkScalar  radius,
const SkPaint & 
) 
 

Draw the specified circle using the specified SkPaint. If radius is <= 0, then nothing will be drawn. The circle will be filled or framed based on the kStroke_Mask bit in the paint.

void SkCanvas::drawColor (  SkColor   ) 
 

Fill the entire canvas' bitmap (restricted to the current clip) with the specified color.

void SkCanvas::drawLine (  SkScalar  x0,
SkScalar  y0,
SkScalar  x1,
SkScalar  y1,
const SkPaint & 
) 
 

Draw a line segment with the specified start and stop x,y coordinates, using the specified paint. NOTE: since a line is always "framed", the kStroke_Mask bit is ignored in the paint.

void SkCanvas::drawLine (  const SkPoint &  start,
const SkPoint &  stop,
const SkPaint & 
) 
 

Draw a line segment with the specified start and stop points, using the specified paint. NOTE: since a line is always "framed", the kStroke_Mask bit is ignored in the paint.

void SkCanvas::drawOval (  const SkRect &  oval,
const SkPaint & 
) 
 

Draw the specified oval using the specified SkPaint. The oval will be filled or framed based on the kStroke_Mask bit in the paint.

void SkCanvas::drawPaint (  const SkPaint &   ) 
 

Fill the entire canvas' bitmap (restricted to the current clip) with the specified SkPaint. This is equivalent (but faster) to drawing an infinitely large rectangle with the specified paint.

void SkCanvas::drawPath (  const SkPath &  ,
const SkPaint & 
) 
 

Draw the specified path using the specified SkPaint. The path will be filled or framed based on the kStroke_Mask bit in the paint.

void SkCanvas::drawRect (  const SkRect &  ,
const SkPaint & 
) 
 

Draw the specified SkRect using the specified SkPaint. The rectangle will be filled or framed based on the kStroke_Mask bit in the paint.

SkScalar  rx,
SkScalar  ry,
const SkPaint & 
) 
 

Draw the specified round-rect using the specified SkPaint. The round-rect will be filled or framed based on the kStroke_Mask bit in the paint.

Parameters:
rx The X-radius of the oval used to round the corners
ry The Y-radius of the oval used to round the corners

void SkCanvas::drawText (  const char  text[],
size_t  byteLength,
SkScalar  x,
SkScalar  y,
const SkPaint & 
) 
 

Draw the utf8-text, with origin at (x,y), using the specified SkPaint. The origin is interpreted based on the Align setting in the SkPaint.

Parameters:
text The UTF8 text to be drawn
byteLength The number of bytes to read from the text parameter
paint The paint used for the text (e.g. color, size, style)

size_t  numberOf16BitValues,
SkScalar  x,
SkScalar  y,
const SkPaint & 
) 
 

Draw the utf8-text, with origin at (x,y), using the specified SkPaint. The origin is interpreted based on the Align setting in the SkPaint.

Parameters:
text The UTF16 text to be drawn
numberOf16BitValues The number of 16bit values to read from the text parameter
paint The paint used for the text (e.g. color, size, style)

void SkCanvas::drawText16OnPath (  const U16  text[],
size_t  numberOf16BitValues,
const SkPath &  path,
SkScalar  offset,
const SkPaint &  paint
) 
 

Draw the utf8-text, with origin at (x,y), using the specified SkPaint, along the specified path. The paint's Align setting determins where along the path to start the text.

Parameters:
text The UTF16 text to be drawn
numberOf16BitValues The number of 16bit values to read from the text parameter
path The path the text should follow for its baseline
offset The distance along the path to add to the text's starting position
paint The paint used for the text (e.g. color, size, style)

void SkCanvas::drawTextOnPath (  const char  text[],
size_t  byteLength,
const SkPath &  path,
SkScalar  offset,
const SkPaint &  paint
) 
 

Draw the utf8-text, with origin at (x,y), using the specified SkPaint, along the specified path. The paint's Align setting determins where along the path to start the text.

Parameters:
text The UTF8 text to be drawn
byteLength The number of bytes to read from the text parameter
path The path the text should follow for its baseline
offset The distance along the path to add to the text's starting position
paint The paint used for the text (e.g. color, size, style)

SkBounder* SkCanvas::getBounder (   )  const [inline]
 

Return the installed bounder (or nil). Does not affect the bounder's reference count.

U32 SkCanvas::getPaintClearBits (   )  const
 

Return the current clear mask, used to temporarily modify the paint's flags when something is being drawin.

U32 SkCanvas::getPaintSetBits (   )  const
 

Return the current set mask, used to temporarily modify the paint's flags when something is being drawin.

void SkCanvas::getPixels (  SkBitmap *   )  const
 

Return a copy of the bitmap that the canvas draws into. This does not make a copy of the bitmap's pixels, but just returns the pixel's address.

int SkCanvas::getSaveCount (   )  const
 

Returns the number of matrix/clip states on the SkCanvas' private stack. This will equal # save() calls - # restore() calls.

void SkCanvas::orPaintSetClearBits (  U32  setBits,
U32  clearBits
) 
 

Helper for getPaintSetClearBits/setPaintSetClearBits. The parameters are OR'd into the current values, rather than replacing them as with setPaintSetClearBits.

bool SkCanvas::quickReject (  SkScalar  left,
SkScalar  top,
SkScalar  right,
SkScalar  bottom,
bool  antialiased = false
)  const [inline]
 

Helper version of quickReject(const SkRect&, ...)

bool SkCanvas::quickReject (  const SkPath &  ,
bool  antialiased = false
)  const
 

Return true if the specified path, after being transformed by the current matrix, would lie completely outside of the current clip. Call this to check if an area you intend to draw into is clipped out (and therefore you can skip making the draw calls). Note, for speed it may return false even if the path itself might not intersect the clip (i.e. the bounds of the path intersects, but the path doesnot).

Parameters:
path The path to check against
antialiased true if the path should be considered antialiased, since that means it may affect a larger area (more pixels) than non-antialiased.
Returns:
true if the path (transformed by the canvas' matrix) does not intersect with the canvas' clip

bool SkCanvas::quickReject (  const SkRect &  ,
bool  antialiased = false
)  const
 

Return true if the specified rectangle, after being transformed by the current matrix, would lie completely outside of the current clip. Call this to check if an area you intend to draw into is clipped out (and therefore you can skip making the draw calls).

Parameters:
rect the rect to check against
antialiased true if the rect should be considered antialiased, since that means it may affect a larger area (more pixels) than non-antialiased.
Returns:
true if the rect (transformed by the canvas' matrix) does not intersect with the canvas' clip

void SkCanvas::restore (   ) 
 

This call balances a previous call to save(), and is used to remove all modifications to the matrix/clip state since the last save call. It is an error to call restore() more times than save() was called.

void SkCanvas::restoreToCount (  int  saveCount  ) 
 

Efficient way to pop any calls to save() that happened after the save count reached saveCount.

bool SkCanvas::rotate (  SkScalar  degrees,
SkScalar  px,
SkScalar  py
) 
 

Preconcat the current matrix with the specified rotation and pivot point. The pivot is the point that will remain unchanged after the rotation is applied.

Parameters:
degrees The amount to rotate, in degrees
px The pivot's X coordinate
py The pivot's Y coordinate returns true if the operation succeeded (e.g. didn't overflow)

void SkCanvas::save (   ) 
 

This call saves the current matrix and clip information, and pushes a copy onto a private stack. Subsequent calls to translate,scale,rotate,skew,concat or clipRect,clipPath all operate on this copy. When the balancing call to restore() is made, this copy is deleted and the previous matrix/clip state is restored.

bool SkCanvas::scale (  SkScalar  sx,
SkScalar  sy,
SkScalar  px,
SkScalar  py
) 
 

Preconcat the current matrix with the specified scale and pivot point. The pivot is the point that will remain unchanged after the scale is applied.

Parameters:
sx The amount to scale in X, about the pivot point (px,py)
sy The amount to scale in Y, about the pivot point (px,py)
px The pivot's X coordinate
py The pivot's Y coordinate returns true if the operation succeeded (e.g. didn't overflow)

SkBounder* SkCanvas::setBounder (  SkBounder *   ) 
 

Set a new bounder (or nil), incrementing the new bounder's reference count (if not nil) and decrementing the previous bounder's reference count (if not nil).

Returns:
the new bounder (or nil if nil was specified)

void SkCanvas::setPaintSetClearBits (  U32  setBits,
U32  clrBits
) 
 

Set the current set and clear masks, used to temporarily modify the paint's flags when something is being drawin. The setBits are applied before the clrBits.

Parameters:
setBits A mask of bits to be OR'd into the paint's flag bits
clrBits A mask of bits to be cleared from the paint's flag bits

void SkCanvas::setPixels (  const SkBitmap &   ) 
 

Specify a bitmap for the canvas to draw into. This routine makes a copy of the bitmap, but does not copy the actual pixels. Ownership of the bitmap's pixels stays with the caller's bitmap.

bool SkCanvas::skew (  SkScalar  sx,
SkScalar  sy,
SkScalar  px,
SkScalar  py
) 
 

Preconcat the current matrix with the specified skew and pivot point. The pivot is the point that will remain unchanged after the skew is applied.

Parameters:
sx The amount to skew in X, about the pivot point (px,py)
sy The amount to skew in Y, about the pivot point (px,py)
px The pivot's X coordinate
py The pivot's Y coordinate returns true if the operation succeeded (e.g. didn't overflow)

bool SkCanvas::translate (  SkScalar  dx,
SkScalar  dy
) 
 

Preconcat the current matrix with the specified translation

Parameters:
dx The distance to translate in X
dy The distance to translate in Y returns true if the operation succeeded (e.g. didn't overflow)
